title: How to Make Honey Bran Muffins

steps.headline: Mix the raisins and pineapple juice in a small bowl.
steps.description: Set on the side for the raisins to soak up the juice flavor.

steps.headline: Mix the flour, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl.
steps.description: Carefully fold in the cereal and set on the side.

steps.headline: Mix the eggs, brown sugar, honey, and oil in a large bowl.
steps.description: Add the floured cereal mixture and mix.

steps.headline: Fold the pineapple juice and raisins in.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap.
steps.description: Refrigerate for at least 3 hours to overnight. The mixture will thicken as it chills.

steps.headline: Fill paper lined muffin cups, about 3/4 full.
steps.description: Don't overfill the cups as the mixture will rise during baking.

steps.headline: Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.
steps.description: Do a toothpick test to be sure it's thoroughly done. Remove and cool completely on a wire rack.

text: Mix the raisins and pineapple juice in a small bowl. Set on the side for the raisins to soak up the juice flavor. Mix the flour, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl. Carefully fold in the cereal and set on the side. Mix the eggs, brown sugar, honey, and oil in a large bowl. Add the floured cereal mixture and mix. Fold the pineapple juice and raisins in.  Cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours to overnight. The mixture will thicken as it chills. Preheat the oven to 400ºF/205ºC.  Fill paper lined muffin cups, about 3/4 full. Don't overfill the cups as the mixture will rise during baking. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Do a toothpick test to be sure it's thoroughly done. Remove and cool completely on a wire rack. Finished.
